definition: to leave (the stage, an exam room, the playing field etc)/to take part in some activity/to take an examination (in the imperial examination system)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: The subject for discussion was the future of Rommel and his Africa Corps.
sentences.chinese: 讨论的题目是隆美尔及其非州军团的下场。

sentences.english: End of Nanjing has a team vs. Chongchao popular Chengdu Sheffield United.
sentences.chinese: 下场南京有有队将主场迎战冲超热门的成都谢菲联队。

sentences.english: Syme's fate was not difficult to foresee.
sentences.chinese: 赛麦的下场是不难预见的。

sentences.english: Bad people always come to a sticky end.
Betray a friend, and you'll often find you have ruined yourself.
sentences.chinese: 背叛朋友，你也不会有好下场。

sentences.english: Imagine the next game — I could have a heart problem.
sentences.chinese: 想象一下下场比赛，我可能就有心脏病了。

sentences.english: A saturating rain was expected to end the drought.
sentences.chinese: 只盼下场透雨，解除旱情。

sentences.english: A basketball player is allowed five personal fouls before fouling out.
sentences.chinese: 篮球运动员侵人犯规五次即被罚下场。

sentences.english: Severe consequences happen to those who trust in the frailty of people.
sentences.chinese: 那些将信任放在软弱人身上的人，会有严重的下场。

sentences.english: John the Baptist was faithful, but he was beheaded.
sentences.chinese: 施洗约翰也尽忠，下场却是被斩首。

sentences.english: It is because of her that I am here today.
sentences.chinese: 就是因为她我才落个今天这样的下场。

sentences.english: That's what she gets for eating my roast beef sandwich.
sentences.chinese: 哈哈，这就是你偷吃我的烧牛肉三明治的下场。

sentences.english: Ferdinand left the field ahead of time during Saturday's Man Utd match against Watford.
sentences.chinese: 费迪南德在周六曼联与沃特福德的比赛中提前下场。

sentences.english: Huntelaar instead came on after the first 15 minutes to replace the injured Van Persie.
sentences.chinese: 亨特拉尔第15分钟替换受伤下场的范佩西出场。

sentences.english: Occasionally, at least, Harris and Lopez should carry them to a victory.
sentences.chinese: 至少，哈里斯和洛佩兹应该偶尔率队赢下场比赛。

sentences.english: The meeting was scheduled for two hours- neverthelessas now over yet.
sentences.chinese: 会议原定了两个小时，不过方今还没有下场。

definition: ending up as/leading to/resulting in/in total
on stage/to go on stage/to take the field
to sustain injuries/wounded (in an accident etc)/harmed
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
(coll.) to take a taxi/to go by taxi
to have bad luck/to be out of luck
to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
